gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਅਨਚਰ ਨਰਪਤ ਕੀ ਪਛਾਨੈਂ ਭਾਖਾ ਬੋਲਤ ਬਚਨ ਖਿਨ ਬੂਝ ਬਿਨ ਦੇਖ ਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Anachar Narapat Kee Pachhaanain Bhaakhaa , Bolat Bachan Khin Boojh Bin Daykh Hee ?
translation: Just as an attendant on king waits behind him and recognises his sound and utterances without even seeing the king.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜੌਹਰੀ ਪਰਖ ਜਾਨਤ ਹੈ ਰਤਨ ਕੀ ਦੇਖਤ ਹੀ ਕਹੈ ਖਰੌ ਖੋਟੋ ਰੂਪ ਰੇਖ ਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Jauharee Parakh Jaanat Hai Ratan Kee , Daykhat Hee Kahai Kharau Khoto Roop Raykh Hee ?
translation: Just as a gemologist knows the art of evaluating the precious stones and is able to declare whether a stone is fake or genuine by a look on its form.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਖੀਰ ਨੀਰ ਕੋ ਨਿਬੇਰੋ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਨੈ ਹੰਸ ਰਾਖੀਅੈ ਮਿਲਾੲਿ ਭਿੰਨ ਭਿੰਨ ਕੈ ਸਰੇਖ ਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Kheer Neer Ko Nibayro Kari Jaanai Hansa , Raakheeai Milaai Bhinn Bhinn Kai Saraykh Hee ?
translation: Just as a swan knows how to separate milk and water and is able to do in no time.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਨਤ ਪਹਿਚਾਨੈ ਸਿਖ ਅਾਨ ਬਾਨੀ ਕ੍ਰਿਤਮੀ ਨ ਗਨਤ ਹੈ ਲੇਖ ਹੀ ||੫੭੦||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Sabad Sounat Pahichaanai Sikha , Aan Baanee Kritamee N Ganat Hai Laykh Hee ?570?
translation: Similarly, a true Sikh of the True Guru recognises which composition is fake and which one is genuine, created by the True Guru as soon as he hears it. He discards what is not genuine in no time and keeps it in no account.  (570)
